block.p: Kathryn Helen Nicita, a daughter of Helen and William F. Nicita of Brunswick, Me., was married yesterday to Jonathan Choate Shepherd, the son of Joan and Robert Shepherd, also of Brunswick. The Rev. Charles G. Newbery officiated at the Episcopal Church of St. James in Prouts Neck, Me. The Rev. Dr. Robert E. Luccock, a great-uncle of the bride and a United Church of Christ minister, took part in the ceremony.
The couple graduated from Middlebury College.

Kathryn Helen Nicita, a daughter of Helen and William F. Nicita of Brunswick, Me., was married yesterday to Jonathan Choate Shepherd, the son of Joan and Robert Shepherd, also of Brunswick. The Rev. Charles G. Newbery officiated at the Episcopal Church of St. James in Prouts Neck, Me. The Rev. Dr. Robert E. Luccock, a great-uncle of the bride and a United Church of Christ minister, took part in the ceremony.
The couple graduated from Middlebury College.

Mrs. Shepherd, 25, is a stock research analyst in New York for Invesco, an investment management company. Her father, who was until this year an independent distributor of fine art in Brunswick, is a consultant to art dealers. Her mother is an interior decorator in Brunswick.

Mr. Shepherd, 27, is a candidate for an M.B.A. degree at Columbia University. His father owns the Shepherd Agency, a real estate management company in Brunswick, and was the press secretary to Senator Edmund S. Muskie of Maine from 1964 to 1971.
